Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information regarding tower block (over 18m or 6-storeys in height) demolitions within your jurisdiction. I am seeking specifics on the tower names, postcodes, year of demolition, and number of storeys for, either:
A.	All tower block demolitions in the Sheffield City Council,
B. Or, if this is not possible, for specifically the following developments (other location names included in brackets):
1.	Bath House Site (Burncross Road; Chapeltown)
2.	Broomhall (Headford Street)
3.	Claywood (Claywood Drive)
4.	Gleadless Valley (Ironside Road; Gaunt Road; Raeburn Road)
5.	Greenhill Bradway (Atlantic Road; Gervase Avenue)
6.	Middlewood (Winn Gardens)
7.	Norfolk Park (Park Grange Road; St Aidan's Road)
8.	Woodside Lane Area (Pye Bank Road; Andover Street)
Please share regardless of if you hold only partial information on the above. I request that the information be presented as preferably a spreadsheet or PDF. Thank you for your time spent on this request.
Yours faithfully,
Ciara Bolton

Dear Ciara Bolton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Tower Block
Demolitions which we received on 04/02/2024.
I am writing in relation to EIR 1034674 to apologise that we will not be
able to provide a response to your request within the initial timescale
set out in our email of 06/02/24.
Regulation 7(1) of The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR)
enables an authority to extend the 20-working day limit up to 40 working
days if it reasonably believes that the complexity and volume of the
information requested means that it is impracticable either to comply with
the request within the earlier period or to make a decision to refuse to
do so.
In this case, we do reasonably believe that the volume and complexity of
the request makes it impracticable to comply within the 20-working day
limit, and consequently we are extending the deadline by an additional 20
days until 02/04/2024.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Ciara Bolton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Tower Block
Demolitions which we received on 04/02/2024. The reference number for your
request is EIR 1034674. I apologise for the significant delay in
responding to your request and our full reply is now attached together
with relevant documentation, where we hold it. As you will appreciate,
much of the information is historic and we have contacted several council
departments and staff, including at Sheffield Archives. We hope this
answers your request.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response. Of
course, we acknowledge and apologise for the significant delay in
responding.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
